body_html:
I do not see any error, It simply fails when I configure for GPU, and run:
$ bazel test tensorflow/contrib/framework:variables_test -c opt
--config=cuda

On Sat, Oct 1, 2016 at 9:05 PM, Ziming Dong notifications@github.com
wrote:

@suiyuan2009 commented on this pull request.

In tensorflow/contrib/framework/python/ops/variables_test.py
#4077:

  • var = tf.Variable(initializer)
  • var_zero = tf.contrib.framework.zero_initializer(var)
  • with self.test_session() as sess:
  •  with self.assertRaisesOpError("Attempting to use uninitialized value"):

  •    var.eval()

  •  if use_init:

  •    sess.run(var.initializer)

  •    with self.assertRaisesOpError("input is already initialized"):

  •      var_zero.eval()

  •    self.assertAllClose(np.ones(shape), var.eval())

  •  else:

  •    var_zero.eval()

  •    self.assertAllClose(np.zeros(shape), var.eval())
  • def testZeroInitializer(self):
  • for dtype in (tf.int32, tf.int64, tf.float32, tf.float64):

What's the error?

body_text:
I do not see any error, It simply fails when I configure for GPU, and run:
$ bazel test tensorflow/contrib/framework:variables_test -c opt
--config=cuda
On Sat, Oct 1, 2016 at 9:05 PM, Ziming Dong notifications@github.com
wrote:

@suiyuan2009 commented on this pull request.
In tensorflow/contrib/framework/python/ops/variables_test.py
#4077:


var = tf.Variable(initializer)
var_zero = tf.contrib.framework.zero_initializer(var)
with self.test_session() as sess:

 with self.assertRaisesOpError("Attempting to use uninitialized value"):



   var.eval()



 if use_init:



   sess.run(var.initializer)



   with self.assertRaisesOpError("input is already initialized"):



     var_zero.eval()



   self.assertAllClose(np.ones(shape), var.eval())



 else:



   var_zero.eval()



   self.assertAllClose(np.zeros(shape), var.eval())





def testZeroInitializer(self):
for dtype in (tf.int32, tf.int64, tf.float32, tf.float64):


What's the error?

body:
I do not see any error, It simply fails when I configure for GPU, and run:
$ bazel test tensorflow/contrib/framework:variables_test -c opt
--config=cuda

On Sat, Oct 1, 2016 at 9:05 PM, Ziming Dong notifications@github.com
wrote:

> ## _@suiyuan2009_ commented on this pull request.
> 
> In tensorflow/contrib/framework/python/ops/variables_test.py
> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/4077:
> 
> > -    var = tf.Variable(initializer)
> > -    var_zero = tf.contrib.framework.zero_initializer(var)
> > -    with self.test_session() as sess:
> > -      with self.assertRaisesOpError("Attempting to use uninitialized value"):
> > -        var.eval()
> > -      if use_init:
> > -        sess.run(var.initializer)
> > -        with self.assertRaisesOpError("input is already initialized"):
> > -          var_zero.eval()
> > -        self.assertAllClose(np.ones(shape), var.eval())
> > -      else:
> > -        var_zero.eval()
> > -        self.assertAllClose(np.zeros(shape), var.eval())
> >   +
> > -  def testZeroInitializer(self):
> > -    for dtype in (tf.int32, tf.int64, tf.float32, tf.float64):
> 
> What's the error?
